intro: Chascanum angolense, commonly known as the Angola chascanum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Chascanum angolense is often found in rocky soils and is known for its resilience in harsh climates.
